response_requirements.initial_response_description: Must acknowledge receipt within 1 business day; must produce records or state grounds for denial within reasonable period of time per agency policy (typically 3 business days)
response_requirements.final_response_notes: Reasonable period of time as defined by each agency's public records policy; ground truth indicates typical response of 3 business days
response_requirements.extension_notes: No specific extension period defined; must respond within 'reasonable period of time' as defined by agency policy

fee_structure.search_fee_notes: No charge for search time; copies provided at actual cost only
fee_structure.copy_fee_notes: Copies provided at actual cost; varies by agency and format

exemptions.description: Medical records and records pertaining to medical treatment
Records pertaining to probation and parole proceedings or sexually violent predator commitments
Records pertaining to adoption proceedings, including contents of adoption files
Records pertaining to actions under section 2151.85 and related juvenile proceedings
Records of ongoing criminal investigations if disclosure would interfere with investigation
Trial preparation records and attorney work product in pending litigation
Records that would constitute unwarranted invasion of personal privacy

appeal_process.first_level_notes: Mandamus action may be filed in court of common pleas of the county where violation occurred, or in Supreme Court or Court of Appeals under original jurisdiction
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: Court costs and reasonable attorney fees awarded to prevailing plaintiff; statutory damages of $100 per business day up to $1,000 if written request made by hand delivery, electronic submission, or certified mail

requester_requirements.purpose_notes: Office may ask for identity and intended use but cannot require disclosure; cannot limit or condition availability based on identity or purpose
requester_requirements.request_format_notes: Office may ask requester to make request in writing but cannot require it; must disclose that written request is not mandatory
requester_requirements.specific_format: Request must fairly describe the public record or class of records sought

agency_obligations.records_officer_notes: Person responsible for public records must be designated but not specifically called 'records officer'
agency_obligations.response_format_options: Records provided in format requested if available
agency_obligations.liberal_construction: Statute construed liberally in favor of broad access
agency_obligations.training_notes: All elected officials or their designees must attend training on public records requirements; all public offices must adopt public records policies

oversight_body.name: Ohio Attorney General
oversight_body.role: Provides guidance and training on public records law; no direct oversight authority
oversight_body.contact_info: Ohio Attorney General's Office, Public Records Section

primary_sources: Ohio Public Records Act statutory text
Ohio Attorney General Sunshine Laws guidance
validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields verified from official Ohio Revised Code. Response timeline: acknowledge within 1 business day, produce records within reasonable time per agency policy (3 business days per ground truth). No specific extension period defined. Mandamus action available with attorney fees and statutory damages ($100/day up to $1,000). Training required for elected officials. Strong requester protections - identity and purpose cannot be required. 31+ statutory exemptions including medical records, ongoing investigations, adoption records, juvenile proceedings.
